casebody.data:
UNITED STATES of America, Plaintiff-Appellee, v. Roosevelt BELL, aka Jerry Wade, aka Jerry Love, aka Mr. T. Wilson, Defendant-Appellant. No. 73-2740

Summary Calendar.*

United States Court of Appeals, Fifth Circuit. Nov. 15, 1973. George W. Reese, George M. Leppert, New Orleans, La., for defendant-appellant. Gerald J. Gallinghouse, U. S. Atty., Stephen A. Mayo, Asst. U. S. Atty., New Orleans, La., for plaintiff-appellee.

Before THORNBERRY, GOLDBERG and RONEY, Circuit Judges.

Rule 18, 5th Cir.; see Isbell Enterprises, Inc. v. Citizens Casualty Co. of New York et al., 5th Cir., 1970, 431 F.2d 409, Part I.

 PER CURIAM:

A careful study of the briefs and a complete review of the record reveal no reversible error in the trial of this case and sufficient evidence to support the jury verdict.

Affirmed.
